title: Iftar Gathering: Iftar Gathering Held
text: Mangaluru: In a display of inter-faith harmony and cultural solidarity, Most Rev Peter Paul Saldanha, bishop, diocese of Mangalore and president of the Father Muller Charitable Institutions, along with N Vinaya Hegde, chancellor of Nitte (deemed to be university), and Yenepoya Abdulla Kunhi, chancellor of Yenepoya (deemed to be university), hosted an iftar gathering on Wednesday. Bishop Saldanha emphasised the importance of unity in diversity, and highlighted the need for mutual respect and understanding to build a more inclusive and harmonious society. He stressed that, “Any war cannot bring peace as it sheds the blood of innocents.” Pro chancellor of Nitte, Shantharam Shetty, gave an impromptu address on behalf of N Vinaya Hegde. Yenepoya Abdulla Kunhi reiterated the importance of interfaith dialogue in promoting peace and harmony. Assembly speaker UT Khader spoke of upholding love and tranquillity among neighbours to maintain harmony in the community. tnnWe also published the following articles recently'Ambedkar laid foundation of harmonious society': RSS chief BhagwatDr Bhagwat emphasized Dr Ambedkar's legacy at Symbiosis University, urging cultural education. The event highlighted the Sangh's commitment to higher education and saw the presence of notable historians and social workers.108714158Ahead of polls, Assam puts curbs on inter-faith land sale for 3 monthsAssam govt suspends NOCs for 3 months to prevent communal tension before Lok Sabha elections, emphasizing indigenous land rights under Mission Basundhara 2.0 and future reforms in Mission Basundhara 3.0.108739488Pisces, Horoscope Today, March 25, 2024: Seek harmony between body, mind, and spiritPisces embrace dreams, intuition, and empathy, enhancing sensitivity and emotional bonds.
